Stack Overflow^[Still around, [despite AI](https://daily.dev/blog/did-stack-overflow-just-admit-defeat-to-ai).] published the [results of their 2025 user survey](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2025/developers/) conducted in May and June. The data features roughly 50,000 responses from 166 countries.

The survey has insights regarding:

- [**Developers**](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2025/developers/): 
  - profession^[Mostly developers]
  - demographics^[Mostly early-career]
  - geography
  - education^[Bachelor and Master dominate.]
  - experience
  - roles
  - industry
  - etc.
- [**Technology**](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2025/technology/): 
  - languages^[SQL comes third, Python fourth.]
  - databases^[PostgreSQL takes first place.]
  - cloud platforms^[Docker dominates.]
  - frameworks
  - development environments^[Microsoft Visual Studio Code for a whopping 75%!]
  - LLMs^[OpenAI GPT over everything, twice as much as Claude Sonnet.]
  - operating systems
  - etc. 
- [**AI**](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2025/ai/): 
  - usage^[Half of respondents use AI daily.]
  - sentiment^[Two thirds: favorable]
  - perceived quality^[So-so]
  - satisfaction and frustrations^[Most frustrating: AI solutions that are almost right, but not quite.]
  - vibe coding
  - roles of humans
  - etc.
- [**Work**](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2025/work/): 
  - employment^[Mostly employed]
  - role
  - company size
  - environment^[One third remote]
  - salary
  - etc.
- [**Stack Overflow itself**](https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2025/stack-overflow/): 
  - account
  - usage
  - frequency
  - etc.
